SEARCH
Package entity

Class Enquiry

java.lang.Object
entity.Enquiry
public class Enquiry extends Object
The Enquiry class represents a question or request from an applicant about a BTO project.

Enquiries are an important communication channel between applicants and HDB managers:

  • Applicants can create enquiries about specific BTO projects
  • HDB Managers can respond to these enquiries
  • The system tracks both the enquiry and response timestamps

Once an enquiry has been replied to, it cannot be edited or deleted.

Version:
1.0

      public Enquiry(String id, User creator, BTOProject project, String content)
      Constructs a new Enquiry with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier for the enquiry
      creator - The user who created the enquiry
      project - The BTO project this enquiry is about
      content - The content/question of the enquiry

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public String getId()
      Gets the unique identifier of the enquiry.
      Returns:
      The enquiry's unique identifier

    • getCreator

      public User getCreator()
      Gets the user who created the enquiry.
      Returns:
      The enquiry creator

    • getProject

      public BTOProject getProject()
      Gets the BTO project this enquiry is about.
      Returns:
      The BTO project

    • getContent

      public String getContent()
      Gets the content/question of the enquiry.
      Returns:
      The enquiry content

    • getReply

      public String getReply()
      Gets the reply to the enquiry.
      Returns:
      The reply, or null if not yet replied to

    • getCreationTime

      public LocalDateTime getCreationTime()
      Gets the date and time when the enquiry was created.
      Returns:
      The creation timestamp

    • getReplyTime

      public LocalDateTime getReplyTime()
      Gets the date and time when the enquiry was replied to.
      Returns:
      The reply timestamp, or null if not yet replied to

    • setContent

      public void setContent(String content)
      Updates the content of the enquiry.

      This can only be done if the enquiry has not yet been replied to.

      Parameters:
      content - The new content

    • addReply

      public void addReply(String reply)
      Adds a reply to the enquiry.

      This also sets the reply timestamp to the current time. Once a reply is added, the enquiry can no longer be modified.

      Parameters:
      reply - The reply content to add

    • canEdit

      public boolean canEdit(User user)
      Checks if the specified user is authorized to edit this enquiry.

      Only the creator of the enquiry can edit it.

      Parameters:
      user - The user attempting to edit the enquiry
      Returns:
      true if the user is authorized to edit, false otherwise

    • hasReply

      public boolean hasReply()
      Checks if this enquiry has been replied to.
      Returns:
      true if the enquiry has a reply, false otherwise
